high_signal_items.title: QuantaAlpha: An Evolutionary Framework for LLM-Driven Alpha Mining
high_signal_items.why_it_matters: QuantaAlpha introduces a novel evolutionary framework for alpha mining that enhances factor discovery through trajectory-level mutation and crossover operations. This approach shows strong robustness under market distribution shifts, making it a promising tool for generating consistent excess returns across different indices.

high_signal_items.title: Insider Purchase Signals in Microcap Equities: Gradient Boosting Detection of Abnormal Returns
high_signal_items.why_it_matters: This research provides a machine learning approach to predict abnormal returns based on insider purchase signals in microcap equities. The gradient boosting classifier achieves significant predictive accuracy, highlighting a momentum pattern that can be exploited for trading strategies.

high_signal_items.title: Algorithmic Monitoring: Measuring Market Stress with Machine Learning
high_signal_items.why_it_matters: The Market Stress Probability Index (MSPI) offers a new method to estimate market stress using machine learning, providing a transparent and easily updated measure of near-term equity-market stress risk. This can be crucial for risk management and strategic asset allocation.

new_agent_ideas.edge_hypothesis: By using trajectory-level mutation and crossover operations, the agent can discover and refine alpha factors that are robust to market regime shifts.
new_agent_ideas.test_plan: Implement the QuantaAlpha framework on historical data from CSI 300 and S&P 500, evaluate the Information Coefficient (IC) and Annualized Rate of Return (ARR) over multiple market conditions.

new_agent_ideas.edge_hypothesis: Insider purchase signals in microcap equities can predict abnormal returns, especially when disclosed after significant price appreciation.
new_agent_ideas.test_plan: Train a gradient boosting classifier on historical insider purchase data, validate the model on out-of-sample data, and assess the precision and recall of predicted abnormal returns.

new_agent_ideas.edge_hypothesis: Using cross-sectional fragility signals, the agent can estimate the probability of market stress, aiding in proactive risk management.
new_agent_ideas.test_plan: Develop the MSPI using historical CRSP data, backtest its predictive accuracy during known stress periods, and compare against traditional volatility measures.

new_data_sources.name: CRSP Daily Data
new_data_sources.use_case: Used for constructing the Market Stress Probability Index (MSPI) to estimate market stress probabilities.

new_data_sources.name: SEC Form 4 Filings
new_data_sources.use_case: Provides insider transaction data for predicting abnormal returns in microcap equities.
